ygData.subject: RE: Bard Song Analysis Spreadsheet Available
ygData.msgSnippet: When you train in a non-language skill you should be getting it with a number of skill points equal to your level, not the max for your level (unless they
ygData.messageBody:
When you train in a non-language skill you should be getting it with a
number of skill points equal to your level, not the max for your level
(unless they changed this on us recently). So training at level 18 should
have started you with a skill of 18 instead of 11. Granted that an extra 7
skill points is no comparison to 35 but those 7 that you get are more
important, I think. I have always trained my skills to 21 when I had the
extra points. The skills seem to take off faster from 20 than they do from
10.
I think the reason we got brass at level 11 is because the current song for
level 11 isn't the original. For the life of me I can't remember what the
old one back in Beta4 was but I think it might have been a brass song.

Good Journey

Sineras Silverlyre, The Divine Alliance (Cazic-Thule)

-----Original Message-----
From: Valharick@... [mailto:Valharick@...]
Sent: Wednesday, December 29, 1999 10:36 PM
To: eqbards@onelist.com
Subject: Re: [eqbards] Bard Song Analysis Spreadsheet Available


From: Valharick@...

In a message dated 12/29/99 5:05:45 PM Pacific Standard Time,
legba@... writes:

<< I just hit lvl 11 and got my brass skill. Am I wrong when I look at the
song list, or is the first song I can use this for at lvl 18? Is there
anyway to practice it? >>

Nope your right. And nope there isnt. When I saw this I didnt train my brass
skill until I got my 18th song. This gave me a lil boost in the skill as I
started at 90 instead of 55 skill. A few less missed notes in the long run
:)

Renaldo of the now and forever 37th chorus

with the subject submissions.
